Package fr.m3105.projetmode.model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.m3105.projetmode.utils.Subject
      • fr.m3105.projetmode.model.Model
  • public class Model
extends Subject
    Une classe contenant toutes les données et opérations mathématiques à propos du Modèle qui sera affiché par la vue.
    Author:
    Francois DEROUBAIX, Alban SANNIER, Lohan CALOT

      • Model

        public Model​(File file)
        basic constructor, the parameter file represents the ply file that will be loaded
        Parameters:
        file - : fichier qui sera utiliser pour le parsing

      • Model

        public Model​(File file,
             boolean invert)
        ALTERNATIVE CONSTRUCTOR
        Just a cheap solution of a constructor which don't invert the coordinates
        Parameters:
        file - File object representing the .ply source
        invert - if true, all coordinates will be inverted only useful for test purposes

      • Model

        DO NOT USE : FOR TEST PURPOSES WITHOUT USE OF THE FACES
        Parameters:
        points - : tableau de points servant à généré un modèle

        A constructor that copies the data of the given parameter

        model - The model that will be copied

      • getCenter

        public double[] getCenter()
        Returns the center of the Model. The center is calculated using the average points coordinates
        Returns:
        Point Representing the center of the Model

      • translate

        public void translate​(double[] vector,
                      boolean notify)
        Translates the Model using a Vector
        More precisely, it overwrites the previous values of the Model.points array
        Parameters:
        vector - v representing the directions and distance all the points will translate
        notify - : true if you want to draw, false if is just for calculated

      • translateMultiThread

        public void translateMultiThread​(double[] vector)

      • zoom

        public void zoom​(double relation)
        Increases or decreases the size of the Model (param superior to 0 and inferior to 1 = zoom out, param superior to 1 (excluded) = zoom in)
        Parameters:
        relation - positive double value representing the amount of zoom

      • rotateOnXAxis

        public void rotateOnXAxis​(double angle)
        Rotates the entire Model on the X axis using the double parameter clockwise
        More precisely, it overwrites the previous values of the Model.points array
        WARNING: This method only works with 3d points
        Parameters:
        angle - double value (RADIANS) representing how much the Model will rotate

      • rotateOnYAxis

        public void rotateOnYAxis​(double angle)
        Rotates the entire Model on the Y axis using the double parameter clockwise
        More precisely, it overwrites the previous values of the Model.points array
        WARNING: This method only works with 3d points
        Parameters:
        angle - double value (RADIANS) representing how much the Model will rotate

      • rotateOnZAxis

        public void rotateOnZAxis​(double angle)
        Rotates the entire Model on the Z axis using the double parameter clockwise
        More precisely, it overwrites the previous values of the Model.points array
        WARNING: This method only works with 3d points
        Parameters:
        angle - double value (RADIANS) representing how much the Model will rotate

      • transformPointsOld

        public void transformPointsOld​(double[][] TRANSFORM_MATRIX)
        Changes the values of points array using the double[][] parameter.
        More precisely, this function overwrites the points array using a matricial multiplication of points and the parameter
        CURRENTLY APPLY LIGHTS AT THE END
        Parameters:
        TRANSFORM_MATRIX - : matrix used for transform

      • transformPoints

        public void transformPoints​(double[][] TRANSFORM_MATRIX)

      • applyLights

        public void applyLights​(double[] lightSourcePoint)
        Applies lights to all FACES
        Parameters:
        lightSourcePoint - double[3] representing the coordinates of the lightsource point

      • getNorm

        public double getNorm​(double[] vector)
        Returns the norm (consider the distance) of a given vector
        Parameters:
        vector - double[3] array representing the coordinates of the vector
        Returns:
        double the norm

      • getNormalUnitVector

        public double[] getNormalUnitVector​(int idxFace)
        Returns the normal vector using the coordinates of a Face's points.
        Basically this method calculates the cross product of the two first points located at the idxFace index.
        Parameters:
        idxFace - the index of the face you wish to get the normal vector
        Returns:
        double[3] the normal vector

      • divideByNorm

        public double[] divideByNorm​(double[] vector)
        Returns the vector given vector (double[3]) in parameter by it's norm.
        Parameters:
        vector - vector
        Returns:
        double[] the vector coordinates divided by it's norm

      • determineVector

        public double[] determineVector​(int idxFace,
                                int idxPointA,
                                int idxPointB)
        Using two points, returns the vector of the given points.
        Moreover, this function requires firstly the index of the face where the two points are stored and secondly the indexes of those points.
        Parameters:
        idxFace - int the index of the face stored in FACES array
        idxPointA - int the index of the first point stored in points array
        idxPointB - int the index of the second point stored in points array
        Returns:
        double[3] the vector of the two points

      • toStringPoint

        public String toStringPoint​(int idxPoint)
        A basic toString function dealing with points.
        Given an integer (basically the index), this function will return a String containing the 3 coordinates of this given point
        Parameters:
        idxPoint - int : the index of the point located in the points array
        Returns:
        String textual representation of the point

        public void restoreColor()

        public boolean isColored()
